comments.body: I like it, except for the luck effect. It doesn't really make sense. And, i think instead of cooking it in a smoker, it should be placed on a campfire for 2 minutes, or have multiple stages of cooking, and be needed to be run through the furnace (at usual time) multiple times before it is ready.
What kind of grinch reference is it, because I LOVE it. Upvoted.

This idea goes very well with my own idea of a Feast & Beast update idea, but the glazed roast giving luck Indeed doesn’t make any sense, I think it should give strength or resistance as an effect as it comes from a hoglin, it seems like it makes sense thematically to me .

I think it would be an interesting and perhaps strange bit of trivia to have vines give you water bottles when clicked on with a glass bottle, possibly restricted to the jungle biome. I learned about how vines have lots of water but the water tension can prevent people from easily getting it with a machete. Would be an interesting addition, instead of a cauldron or water source to gather water from.
Vines should be an alternative way to get string. It should maybe be called Stingy Vines, and be colored green, but still work exactly like string.
Hmm, maybe instead of just using phantom membrane it uses a new alloy called phantom steel (crafted with 1 iron ingot and 8 membrane) and it can’t be enchanted just to make it balanced!
THIS IS THE BEST IDEA I'VE EVER HEARD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

We need some kind of ore that can be crafted like this in the nether, though I would prefer it if the gear were equal to diamond, or maybe equal to iron with some unusual effects, sort of like turtle shells.

Yes! This is definitely needed. However, two things- netheorite ore is a kind of redundant name, so it should be called just netherite. Also, building on what the above user said, netherite items should be just as powerful/durable as diamond items, but with an added buff (extra fire resistance?)
Netherorite tools should have an auto smelt/ auto cook effect for items that can be cooked or smelted
Netherorite tools should have an auto smelt/ auto cook effect for items that can be cooked or smelted
Wow this became an actual feature, not exactly as I predicted but very similar
This is something that I would like to see. It could make some interesting fights with mobs, where the slime is chasing you and you can't move fast enough to escape. Sign me up :D
I will vote to this but in the hope that instead slimes and magma cubes do stick to actual slime blocks instead
I just don't like counterintuitive things. If they don't jump as high, they should glide as if in ice because they don't stick to each other
I was about to write this too, you beat me to it
What benefit would they have on the player

If you could smelt diamond armor/tools to obtain them, it would make diamonds renewable, and it wouldn't be to bad for an economy, as you still have to wait for the villagers to upgrade, and restock, and you have to do it nine times to get just one diamond.

I think the Charred Bonemeal should work like Bonemeal but only for the trees in the Nether. If you use the Charred Bonemeal in the Overworld on saplings or grass, the saplings would turn into dead bushes, Grass Blocks would turn into Dirt, Tallgrass simply dies (disappears) and around the block around which you have placed the Charred Bonemeal, would be a short Wither effect.

A adição que eu gostaria que vcs fizessem é os meio blocos de pedra da escada. Como assim? Eu gostaria que tivesse no cortador de pedra a função de cortar uma escada e transformasse em um meio bloco conforme o bloco. Séria uma boa reciclagem de blocos e vez de ir atrás de mais.

I think we should first have an olive dye (green + yellow)

I think since the Sniffer is in 1.20 and the whole idea is to sniff up new seeds for more flowers, a better way to implement new dyes is to have them be crafted from different flowers coming from the new flowers. Roger Badgerman (a very reliable Minecraft leaker) leaked a picture of a neon-like blue cocoon which could make the turquoise dye.

I've had the same idea. Would be cool if the text showed on all the sides (and top and bottom, oriented the way you were facing). Since we have the stonecutter, I feel like this block should be crafted in that. Also I'd imagine it looking more similar to the polished stones, perhaps with a slightly fancier border.

This would also go extremely well with my other idea for signs which is quartz signs, which only display their text when powered. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360050385351-Quartz-signs
This is idea is great, and I am not just saying that because I thought of this idea this morning and really did not think someone else would have the exact same idea two year before I did.

Hey, I was thinking about also having the purple mushrooms be dangerous to collect. So, purple mushrooms themselves won't hurt you, but there is a creature Croakstool, see here) that looks like purple mushrooms, and poisons the player. This would be the only hostile mob on the mushroom island, and at that it would not move, and you could easily avoid it be avoiding purple mushrooms.
